BioModel.name: CM_PM12648679_MB3::Protein_phosphorylation_sigmoidal
BioModel.text: This ModelBrick from the article, " Sniffers, buzzers, toggles and blinkers â€¦" describes protein phosphorylation and dephosphorylation reactions governed by Michelis-Menten kinetics, yielding a sigmoidal signal-response curve.
S = signal strength. For example, S could be the concentration of mRNA.
phosphorylated form of the response element. The phosphorylated form of R is supposed to be the active form.

response magnitude. For example, R could be the concentration of protein. The phosphorylated form of R is supposed to be the active form.
